abstract: A brave new world of computer piecework will not automatically provide opportunities for human development or dignity, an economist writes.
snippet: A brave new world of computer piecework will not automatically provide opportunities for human development or dignity, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Nancy Folbre is an economics professor at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst. She recently edited and contributed to “For Love and Money: Care Provision in the United States.“

headline.main: The Unregulated Work of Mechanical Turk
